text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 2.3.80, IDRS Terminal Responses, Command Code DDBKD .
A new IRM 2.3.80.1 was created to comply with the internal control requirements set forth in IRM 1.11.2.2.5, IRM Standards, Address Management and Internal Controls .
Subsequent IRM subsections renumbered due to addition of the new 2.3.80.1.

2.3.80.1 Internal Controls updated to include the following ﬁelds: Background, Authority, Roles and Responsibilities, Program Management and Review, Program Controls, Terms/Deﬁnitions/Acronyms, and Related Resources.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
IRM 2.3.80, dated 6-26-2020, is superseded.
Large Business and International (LB&I), Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE).
Table of Contents
Program Scope and Objectives
) Program Scope and Objectives (

) Command Code (CC) DDBKD is used to display a variety of information from multiple sources for the Social Security Number (SSN) that is entered. This is maintained within the Dependent Database (DDB) project. (
) Purpose : This IRM section provides instructions for using the Integrated Data Retrieval System (IDRS) Command Code DDBKD. (
) Audience : Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE). (
) Policy Owner : Wage & Investment (W&I). (
) Program Owner : Wage & Investment (W&I). (
) Primary Stakeholders : Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self- Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE). (
) Program Goals : The primary use of Command Code DDBKD is to display ditional information about a child for Remote Exam to audit returns under the DDB project..
) Background (
) The Dependent Database (DDB) is a Rules Based selection application that designed to identify Individuals (IMF) and Businesses (BMF) claiming unen- titled tax returns. (
) The primary use of Command Code DDBKD is to display additional information about a child for Remote Exam to audit returns under the DDB project. (

) The sources of data displayed comes from Social Security Administration, Health & Human Services, and IRS. The primary use of this command code to display additional information about a child for Remote Exam to audit returns under the Dependent Database program.
) Authority (
) None
) Responsibilities or and Responsibilities (
) Wage and Investment RICS Business partners provide design, program re- quirements and documentation. (
) Applications Development is responsible for Operations and Maintenance of the command codes.
) Program Management Review (
) Audience: W&I, SB/SE, LB&I, and TE/GE. (
) Policy Owner: W&I. (
) Program Owner: W&I.
) Program Controls (
) Primary Stakeholders: W&I, SB/SE, LB&I, and TE/GE. Command Code DDBKD
page
Audience : Wage & Investment (W&I), Small Business Self-Employed (SB/SE), Large Business and International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt and Government
The Dependent Database (DDB) is a Rules Based selection application that is designed to identify Individuals (IMF) and Businesses (BMF) claiming unen-
The primary use of Command Code DDBKD is to display additional information about a child for Remote Exam to audit returns under the DDB project.
Primary Stakeholders: W&I, SB/SE, LB&I, and TE/GE.
By entering a SSN, Command Code (CC) DDBKD allows a user to display a variety of information about the SSN that comes from external sources.
This information is also available by CC INOLE. N/A will be displayed if no data was found for the SSN entered.
FCR data may be available for a child if a divorce decree was issued, or if the child is on public assistance. If no FCR data is available, N/A will be displayed.
The following Kidlink information (from SSA) is displayed: a. Child’s Name b. Birth Mother’s SSN and Name c. Birth Father’s SSN and Name
Generally, Kidlink data is only available for children born after 1998. If no Kidlink data is available, the literal ‘NO DATA’ will be displayed.
The following Numident information (from SSA) is displayed:
) The following Numident information (from SSA) is displayed: a. Birth Mother’s Name b. Birth Father’s Name (

) The following DUPTIN information will be displayed for the current tax year and two prior tax years for the SSN entered: a. a. The primary SSN of the return that this SSN appeared on. (Listed in the order they were ﬁled. Up to
returns are listed vertically.) b. b. How it was used on the return (As a primary, secondary, dependent
For detailed list of how a SSN was used on returns, please use Command Code DUPOL.
The following DM
information from SSA is displayed: a. Date of Birth b. Date of Death c. DM
update Date d. Citizenship code e. Current SSA name control
This information is also available by CC INOLE. N/A will be displayed if no data was found for the SSN entered.
The following FCR information (Federal Case Registry from HHS) are displayed:
FCR data may be available for a child if a divorce decree was issued, or if the child on public assistance. If no FCR data is available, N/A will be displayed.
) The following Kidlink information (from SSA) is displayed: a. Child’s Name b. Birth Mother’s SSN and Name c. Birth Father’s SSN and Name
Generally, Kidlink data is only available for children born after 1998. If no Kidlink data is available, the literal ‘NO DATA’ will be displayed.
The following Numident information (from SSA) is displayed:
When the additional Numident information is not available, the literal ’*** NO NUMIDENT RECORD FOUND ***’ will be displayed.
The following DUPTIN information will be displayed for the current tax year and two prior tax years for the SSN entered:
and two prior tax years for the SSN entered: a. a. The primary SSN of the return that this SSN appeared on. (Listed in the order they were ﬁled. Up to
returns are listed vertically.) b. b. How it was used on the return (As a primary, secondary, dependent and/or EIC qualifying child)
For detailed list of how a SSN was used on returns, please use Command Code DUPOL.
